channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside of Regents Court St Stephens Road, 24th February
item.description:
We have problems seaing other motovehicles due to the parking blocking the driveway

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Saint Stephen's Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A series of potholes have opened up on a previously attempted repair, 24th February
item.description:
The location is in the "Traffic Calming Area" in Hatherley lane opposite the entrance to Wade Court and right outdside the model railway centre. There have been several attempted repairs whereby some tarmac has been thorown into the holes that were obviously never sealed, hence the water has found its way under the repair and greatly enlarged the problem. When confronted with oncoming traffic it is impossible to avoid the holes and even worse for the poor cyclist.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lifting/loose kerb stone in Brookfield Lane Churchdown, 24th February
item.description:
One of the kerb stones that is part of the dropped kerb for house numbers 51 & 53 Brookfield Lane has lifted and is loose. The amount of rain recently has made the problem worse and could now be considered a trip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brookfield Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
